bio:
Australia’s First Professional Instagrammer 🦄💜
📧: info@laurenbath.com
📸: Olympus E-M1 Mark II
🌏: Western Australia
My TripAdvisor travel feed 😱👇🏻

list.comment:
My FAVOURITE thing about Western Australia, if I had to choose, is definitely sunset over the ocean. Number one: I don’t have to wake up for sunrise and number two: there’s just such a chill vibe when you’re watching the sun go down at the beach. Garry and I photographed this amazing sunset at Scarborough Beach with tummies full of delicious food and the sounds of a live band trickling down from the Scarborough Sunset Markets. (Held every Thursday night until April 2019!) 💜💜💜@WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #WesternAustralia #Australia #ThisIsWA #ScarboroughBeach #ScarboroughSunsetMarkets #OlympusInspired #Sunset

Omg, I seriously don’t think I’ve posted this late in years! I think I’m going to become a night owl this month to catch up on work. This is the Field of Light: Avenue of Honour, although you’ll have to wait until next week for the story as my stories and posts are out of sync. Haha. But this place is incredible and sad and poignant and meaningful. It’s a tribute to the ANZAC’s that departed from Albany for the First World War and it will be on display until ANZAC day 2019, right at the National Anzac Centre in Albany. I was personally blown away to learn and experience everything here at this special place and I hope that some of you make the pilgrimage to this side of Australia between now and the 100 year anniversary of the end of the war. ❤️ @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #WesternAustralia #Australia #ThisIsWA #FieldOfLightAlbany #AvenueOfHonour #FieldOfLights #Albany

Guess what? THAT’S ME IN THE PHOTO!! I know, it’s super rare for me to post a shot that I didn’t take, but since I got into the freezing cold Indian Ocean for this I felt like I deserved a crack at posting it too! 🥶😂 This was taken by my bestie @Garry_Norris at The Aquarium, a gorgeous natural swimming hole near Smiths Beach in Margaret River. The weather was insanely gorgeous, Garry had a special drone permit to drone in the National Park and we had a guide with us, Janita from Cape to Cape Explorer Tours, so it was on! I stripped off, the weather stayed gorgeous and Garry did all the hard work flying his drone. It was cold, yes, but it was also delightfully refreshing! @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #MargaretRiver #SmithsBeach #WesternAustralia #Australia #TheAquarium #CapeToCapeExplorerTours

Reminiscing on my experience swimming with humpback whales and feeling a whole bunch of gratitude for the life that I lead, the brands that I work with (Olympus I’m looking at you) and the people that I’m surrounded by. I’m so lucky for all that I have and never a day goes by that I don’t remember to feel that. @Olympus_Au #OlympusInspired

No trip to Western Australia is complete without a helicopter flight, I swear I have actually never been on a trip here without going up! 🚁 Garry and I were incredibly fortunate to have an hour in the air with Scenic Helicopters and I was pretty stoked to fly over Castle Rock. Do you recognize the tents from my first shot of the Gourmet Escape? If you’re ever fortunate enough to go up in a helicopter with your camera I’d recommend asking the operator to take the doors off for you. It’s a more exhilarating ride and heaps better for photos. Most will be happy to do it for you, on request. 😍 @GourmetEscape @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #MargaretRiver #Helicopter #ScenicHelicopters #WesternAustralia #Australia

If anyone caught my latest story you’ll see that I was lucky enough to do 6km of the Cape to Cape track in Margaret River with Cape to Cape Explorer Tours. This is where we finished up, at Smiths Beach. I’m super happy to see that there’s still some wildflowers around, they had a massive season this year! Also pretty happy that all the eating I’m doing at the Gourmet Escape is being balanced with some outdoor activities. Haha. Oh, and my Nigella Instagram story is still live over at 👉🏻 @GourmetEscape @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #MargaretRiver #Wildflowers #SmithsBeach #CapeToCapeExplorerTours #CapeToCape #WesternAustralia #Australia

If you’ve been following along on my Instagram stories you’ll see that it’s been a pretty crazy time in Margaret River with Gourmet Escape, hiking, indigenous tours and basically all the food! 😂 BUT, we made sure we had time to call into the iconic Busselton Jetty. Isn’t it adorable? @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #WesternAustralia #Australia #Busselton #BusseltonJetty #Jetty #ThisIsWA #Sunset

Guess where I am? OMG, I’m at the Margaret River Gourmet Escape. As in, I’m still here! I’ve been eating and drinking my way through the festival all weekend and also doing a takeover on the @GourmetEscape account. They’ll literally be a story over there tonight from Nigella’s Tea Party at Howard Park, once I get over my food coma and find time to write it. 🙊🍰🍓🍷💁🏼‍♀️ For now, here’s my favorite shot of the festival from sunset at the Beach BBQ. I literally got a wet ass for this photo, a very, very wet ass. @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA #GourmetEscape
.
.
.
.
.
#RestaurantAustralia #WesternAustralia #MargaretRiver #Australia #FoodAndWine #ThisIsWA #SeeAustralia

I’ve been pretty fortunate to spend a lot more time in Perth on this trip to Western Australia, and as such I’ve learnt heaps more about what to do in the surrounding area. Um, did you know there’s an amazing company called Rockingham Wild Encounters that is super close to Perth and offers dolphin swims, sea lion cruises and penguin “feeding”? (NB/ Only a handful of penguins that are in full time care and not eligible for release into the wild) Sadly we didn’t do the wild dolphin swim this time around but we did get to see the dolphins on our sea lion cruise! I love dolphins 💙🐬🐬 @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
.
.
.
.
#SeeAustralia #WesternAustralia #Australia #ThisIsWA #RockinghamWildEncounters #Dolphin

I’ve spent a lot of time recently reflecting on my “why”. Why am I so driven to do what I do? Why do I travel, why do I shoot, why am I here in your lives every single day? For those that don’t know my back story, in my previous life I was a chef. I lived a very small life, a life that had no purpose. Since discovering Instagram, and finding a platform that gave me a voice, I’ve changed fundamentally as a person. I AM a better person, a bigger person and a person that wants to change the world. That WILL change the world. I travel because travel helps me to understand what I need to do. This understanding gives me clarity on my purpose, my legacy. In my life I want to influence others to be better. To ask the big questions, to live big lives and to be f**king passionate about SOMETHING. With our collective passion and energy and clarity and consciousness we can change the world. Thanks to @kerwinrae for reminding me of my power and my purpose.

If anyone is interested I have just popped a link in my bio for my interview with Kerwin Rae. I talk about maximizing Instagram to boost your business. It’s a podcast and goes for roughly one hour, I’d love to hear feedback from anyone who listens! And, omg, don’t laugh when I literally can’t even pronounce “hotel”. 😩😩😂 @kerwinrae #kerwinrae
.
.
.
.
.
#InstagramTips #NoPods #VisitJapanAu #HappySocks #Podcast #Japan #Hokkaido

How do I even start to begin to tell you guys about Katanning? Katanning is a farming town that was probably never on anyone’s radar. Now though? The town has had life breathed back into it, in the form of the old Grain Mill! The Mill was in complete disrepair, on the verge of being condemned, when it was purchased for the bargain price of $1 and transformed into a luxury hotel. The Premier Mill Hotel is exceptional! Absolutely dripping in history and awash with stories with beautiful rooms and public spaces. I’d highly recommend a couple of nights here just to learn more about our history, our farming industry (where our food actually comes from 💁🏼‍♀️) and the small towns that are the back bone of Australia. And if you need any further convincing, the best wine in Australia last year was produced in this region! 😍 @WesternAustralia #JustAnotherDayInWA
.
